elements.label: Main Character
elements.description: Main characters drive the key storylines. The game will end if any of them dies.

elements.label: Secondary Character
elements.description: Secondary characters affect storylines in various ways. Their fates are not tied to endings.

elements.label: Temperament
elements.description: Galen suggests that temperaments are determined by an excess or lack of 4 body fluids.

elements.label: Chapter
elements.description: Indicate the current chapter.

elements.label: Exhausted
elements.description: Exhausted temperament recharges when a new chapter starts.

elements.label: Unconscious
elements.description: The character is unconscious. They will wake up when this aspect reaches 0.

elements.label: Required Event
elements.description: This event has to happen somewhere, either with the right or the wrong people, before the story can progress.

elements.label: End of Chapter
elements.description: This event will end the chapter.

elements.label: Skill: Hunter
elements.description: The character is specialized in hunting using bows and arrows. They have a good eye for preys.

elements.label: Skill: Scholar
elements.description: The character is a book-worm in their area of interests, delving deep and eager to learn.

elements.label: Skill: Archer
elements.description: The character is specialized in using bows and crossbows.

elements.label: Skill: Lancer
elements.description: The character is specialized in using lances.

elements.label: Skill: Observer
elements.description: The character is observant in their daily life. They notice details that may be overlooked by others.

elements.label: Skill: Mathematician
elements.description: The character has studied algebra, geometry, in addition to the basic arithmatics.

elements.label: Skill: Fish-monger
elements.description: The character is specialized in catching fish by using nets, a harpoon, or a fishing rod.

elements.label: Skill: Brewer
elements.description: The character is specialized in making beer and wine, sometimes also vinegar.

elements.label: Skill: Alchemist
elements.description: The character believes in their power of making pure gold or panacea, sometimes also medicine.

elements.label: Skill: Herbalist
elements.description: The character is knowledgeable about various herbs and their effects.

elements.label: Skill: Orator
elements.description: The character is eloquent and good at giving speeches.

elements.label: Skill: Theologian
elements.description: The character is devoted to the study of God and His words, sometimes also bring theology into practice.

elements.label: Memory
elements.description: This is a main character's memory. It might be important enough to change an action in the future.

elements.label: Denier
elements.description: Silver coin. A denier can buy a dozen of eggs.

elements.label: Plant
elements.description: Trees, flowers, herbs, but not mushrooms.

elements.label: Poison
elements.description: If you consume them, maybe you'll die, maybe you'll grow tentacles. Who knows?

elements.label: Medicine
elements.description: Chemicals or herbs that can alleviate or cure diseases, illnesses, or injuries. They are not always effective.

elements.label: Belongs to Bishop
elements.description: This belongs to the Bishop, whatever it means.

elements.label: Belongs to Knight
elements.description: This belongs to the Knight, whatever it means.

elements.label: Belongs to Scribe
elements.description: This belongs to the Scribe, whatever it means.

elements.label: Belongs to Taverner
elements.description: This belongs to the Taverner, whatever it means.

elements.label: Belongs to Doctor
elements.description: This belongs to the Doctor, whatever it means.

elements.label: Belongs to Vicar
elements.description: This belongs to the Vicar, whatever it means.

elements.label: Potential cook
elements.description: This is a potential cook for the tavern. Pick (a reasonable) one before Chapter 6 to avoid a bad ending!

elements.label: Prosper Level
elements.description: This represents the prosper level of the trading post. The knight can use prosper level to recruit soldiers later.
